ac.breakdown: Base Armor Class 10, Base Modifier +7, Dexterity +4
ac.name: ac

description.value: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.
These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.
A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

Adder venom is a simple but effective way to enhance a weapon.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw DC 18 Fortitude

Maximum Duration 3 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d8 #poison]] poison damage (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 1d10 #poison]] poison damage (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 2d6 #poison]] poison damage (1 round)
Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

Trigger A creature targets the Copper Hand rogue with an attack, and the rogue can see the attacker;

Effect The rogue dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

The rogue applies one of their black adder venom poisons to their wielded weapon. If their next attack with that weapon before the end of their next turn hits and deals damage, the target is afflicted with the poison.

The Copper Hand rogue deals [[/r 1d6 #precision]] additional precision damage to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} creatures.

When the monster Strikes a creature that has the flat-footed condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.
